page.title: 15Transport
page.content: The Forth Rail Bridge (see Tourism) is a vital link in North-South travel. Approximately 400 people each day travel in and out of South Queensferry on the half-hourly train service. The weekly fare takings are Â£2583.29. There are 10 goods trains each day. Approximately 1000000 vehicles per month cross over the Forth Road Bridge. The toll charges are 30p per car or car and caravan and 80p per lorry. There is a local taxi service and saloon cars are used by the firm. Eastern Scottish Bus Group have a regular 20 minute service passing through North and South Queensferry.
